misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Correct Implementation of Array Circular Shift
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes the provided algorithm correctly performs a single right circular shift on an array, saving the last element and then shifting all elements (from right to left) by one position before placing the saved element at index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no conceptual gap related to a flawed mental model of the computer. The code implements the standard, correct algorithm for processing a circular array right shift in place: 1. Store the last element (arr[n-1]). 2. Shift elements arr[i-1] into arr[i] for i = (n-1) down to 1. 3. Place the stored element into arr[0]. The array access, assignment, and loop control are all correctly utilized.
